data.prayer: Father, we cry out for a prayer movement in the state of Sool, Somalia. Please, stir the 0 believers here to pray for awakening.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Sool, Somalia
data.section_summary: What beauty can God be thanked for in this photo?

data.prayer: Spirit, train the church of Sool, Somalia to trust with all their hearts, and you will make their paths straight.
data.verse: Trust in Yahweh with all your heart, and don’t lean on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.

data.prayer: Jesus, you said you were the giver of evangelists to the church. Please, send more evangelists to the state of Sool, Somalia.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.prayer: Jesus, teach the believers in the state of Sool that love for you and obedience to you are connected.
data.verse: If you love me, keep my commands.

data.prayer: Spirit, I pray that the Baloch, Southern people will come and worship before you, Lord. May they glorify your name for you are great.
Father, knowing that teachers will be judged more strictly, help the local leaders in Sool, Somalia to be careful with their words.
data.verse: Not many of you should become teachers, my brothers, for you know that we who teach will be judged with greater strictness.

data.prayer: Spirit, guide the 0 believers in the state of Sool into all truth as they interpret Scriptures.
data.verse: For the word of God is alive and active. Sharper than any double-edged sword, it penetrates even to dividing soul and spirit, joints and marrow;

data.prayer: Spirit, please give new believers a yearning to see you praised in Sool, Somalia.
data.verse: Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous deeds among all peoples.

location.name: Sool
location.people_groups_list: Somali Bantu, Swahili, Mahra, Arab, Yemeni, Deaf
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Somali Bantu (769,000), Swahili (201,000), Mahra (4,200), Arab, Yemeni (21,000), Deaf (159,000)
